DataElement.preferredName: Measurable Residual Disease Sensitivity Diagnostic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sensitivity of the modality used to determine minimal residual disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.:Sensitivity of modality used to determine minimal residual disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: remainder of a tumor or a neoplasm/cancer after primary, potentially curative therapy.

Concepts.definition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sensitivity of modality used to determine minimal residual disease.

Concepts.definition: Sensitivity of modality used to determine minimal residual disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 4/16/23 Created for the PCDC-C3DC Aggregated Dictionary data elements. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The probability that a test will produce a true postive result when used on effected subjects as compared to a reference or "gold standard". The sensitivity of a test can be determined by calculating: number of true positive results divided by the sum of true positive results plus number of false negative results._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::10: How many times to divide by a number.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::6: The probability that a test will produce a true postive result when used on effected subjects as compared to a reference or "gold standard". The sensitivity of a test can be determined by calculating: number of true positive results divided by the sum of true positive results plus number of false negative results.
